Headings: TOTAL scam — !! AVOID !!
Content: Took 1.5 rides with Ola in Australia — from Sydney airport, and back. But on the way back it logged me out if my account and wouldn’t let me log back in. I just kept getting a pop-up to contact support.Well, once I still couldn’t log on upon landing in Melbourne, I did. I got a response asking for my IMEI number, gave it, and ... silence.After a few days I emailed again to open a new ticket, including the IMEI up front this time, and ... silence.Did the same and opened a third ticket ... silence. Finally started tweeting at them, super responsive until I actually gave them my info to look up my account/tickets, at which point they just tell you to please give their “concerned team” a bit more time and then just leave you on read.Followed up on the emailed tickets again last night and finally got a response ... asking for my IMEI number. Yes, for real.I’m leaving Australia tomorrow so at this point wish they would just delete all my data. Thank god I could at least unlink Ola from my payment source on PayPal’s side or I wpuld have been really screwed.Wish I read the reviews here before getting into this mess. It’s the kind of cluster that gives us Indians a bad name — it’s why if I had known this was an Indian co, I’d have known to avoid in the first place.

Headings: Beware the possibility of unethical legal action from this indian based company BEFORE installing this app
Content: (This review is based purely on my experience and opinions)I used OLA cabs a few times and was unhappy with the quality of the app which kept crashing and freezing. Sometimes i would i have to wait over 30 minutes just for a ride which displays a driver being "2 minutes away"After i stopped using the app a charge was made to my card of which i did not use anymore. i did not purchase a ride and did not even have the app on my phone. luckily this charge did not go though due to moving money to another bank account. Rather than investigating and listening to my claim i was contacted by a third party via a letter of demand for payment for the unpaid fare that was not mine! despite me informing them that this was likely a fraudulent charge they still have not responded to me directly.I would be very careful. After doing research i found that Ola is not a taxi or cab service rather a corporate rideshare business from india.

Content: Do not ever in your life book a taxi here. My friend had booked her first taxi with the company and is now worried about being alone. The scum driver said things like “tonight will be the best night of your life” and upon reaching her road stopped the car and said “can you wait a few minutes” whilst trying to lock the door. Luckily she was clued on and opened the door before she did, having to run to her house. The driver is “Mahboob Hussain” and is located around Birmingham area. All they did was refund the ride, so we are looking at legal options. Stick to Uber. Avoid at all costs.

Headings: I have  been experiencing the cheating…
Content: I have  been experiencing the cheating practices being adopted by Ola cab in Pune for the last few days.The cheating practice is huge fare difference exhibited at the time of booking vis-a-vis vis actual charged/forcefully debited from the paytm account.Further,the most sad part is ,the request is not entertained with the flimsy excuse" that you have exceeded the time limit and hence the request is not accepted." To substantiate the cheating practices refer CRN 3133683258 at 9.22a.m on 30.05.2019 wherein estimated fare at the time if booking was at Rs.48 and actual charged Rs.68.00.This type of mal practices happened in the past with no tangible results after pointing it out.Jain BhushanMobile no.9511973867

Headings: OLA-THUG PEOPLE
Content: I had worst experience today. I took a cab from Vashi (Navi Mumbai) to Matunga. I selected the payment method as online payment (Debit Card) of Rs. 315. Once I reached the destination I informed CAB driver that I made online payment. He said " Ma'am pehle bolna chahiye tha na abhi nahi hoga. apko cash payment hi karna padega". I said the amount is already deducted from account and payment is done. Still he was not ready to listen. He said you need to pay amount in cash and the amount which was deducted will get refunded in 10 minutes once you call a customer care support number of OLA. I had to pay Rs. 315 in cash. Since then for last 2 hours I am trying to call customer care support but the number is busy and there is no other way to get in touch with them. In OLA payments it's showing I paid Rs. 315 only.I want to know1. Will I really get my money back or it's gone?2. Where is the record of paying Rs.315 from my account?3. What is the number to get in touch with OLA?4. Is there any procedure like when you make online payment you need to pre- inform the driver that you're making the payment online? Because in Uber you can directly do that.

Headings: Unprofessional driver behaviour (nz)
Content: I took Ola for the first time twice yesterday and somehow managed to get 2 drivers in a row who tried to hit on me! The first driver was really nice and we had a great conversation, however at the end he asked me if I had Instagram?? How unprofessional. The second driver was friendly(/flirty) too and in the conversation I ended up telling him I was going back to my boyfriends for the night. After that he stopped being flirty but switched tactics and started asking me how to meet girls. When I told him I met my bf on tinder he asks me to look at his tinder profile and so I could tell him if it was good enough. I wasn’t too bothered but I did feel kind of uncomfortable. Right at the end he asked me to give him a 5 star rating and was very pushy. He asked me to stay in the car after we stopped so I could give him 5 stars. I showed him I did but I didn’t press submit and gave him a much lower rating which I thought was better suited to his unprofessional behaviour. If I do decide to get Ola again it won’t be alone, still an option I guess cos it’s really cheap

I was charged £37 for the trouble.I have forwarded the email offering the ride for £10 to Ola support and they have repeatedly avoided answering the question.....instead reiterating their peak fare policy!TOTAL SCAMMERS! Headings: Waste of life.
Content: I was in Birmingham UK to go see a gig with a mate. We got called over by a group of ola representatives, claiming to offer us a free ride. They kept saying they would take us to the centre of bham for free on little converted mopeds, despite us already being in the centre. We then asked to be taken to the location we required which they then stated they would. Once on the moped, the driver said he wasn’t allowed to take us anywhere as we were only on his moped for promotional reasons. We drove around for 5 mins in a circle, ending up in the same place whilst people took pictures and videos. We then got told to download the app and sign up with their promotional code for a free ride, so we did. We waited 30 mins for a taxi that never arrived. We tried calling the driver and messaging them with no reply. The representatives there at the time just kept telling us to wait, and when I began to show my dissatisfaction, the manager there on the ground told the staff they had to move away from us and focus on obtaining new customers. The worst taxi experience I’ve ever had. The company is focused on money and promotion, but the service they offer is highly lacking.

Headings: OLA - Worst Service Ever For Customers
Content: I have been using OLA for the last 4-5 years and they have been helpful to me always for the exceptional cases where when I was charged more for the trip that I shouldn't just on a call they have refunded the difference amount.That's been the case with Ola Money Wallet. As they have launched Post Paid things have changed drastically. Not been an OLA Fan anymore. I booked a cab via OLA using Ola Post Paid. While booking, I was showed that the estimated fare would be 129 INR around while the trip was ended it came to surprisingly 250 INR.That happened with Post Paid. When I called their customer support I was told that this was because of the rise in fare which is completely false. Because whenever they increase their fare or the prices are up, you see that at the time of booking. They notify you beforehand.The fact was the driver was driving too slow and because of that the trip which was supposed to get over in 15 mins extended to 35 mins.I told them about the issue on call but they ignored it.For one more trip, the driver came to the stop to pick me up, I didn't get the notification for the same and was charged 30 INR extra as waiting fees.Come on if your driver has came to the pick up spot, he has to call at least, or at least notify me on mobile that the cab is here like you guys usually do.This is disgusting. Even now a days, if you have to call their customer support, you have to go through a lot of FAQs first and then only you are able to call them.Disappointed.Not favorites anymore.

Headings: Deceitful company
Content: My first and only experience with Ola was fairly straight forward to begin with - I had a $20 voucher to use as an incentive to try their ride share company for the first time. The app is fairly easy to use, and once the destination was punched in I was given an estimated fare. The ride was fairly standard, and all seemed fine, until I got home and found I was charged an additional $29.52 “fare increase” with no warning or explanation. The app offers no avenue to query or challenge the fare, apart from some unhelpful FAQ’s. After sending a message to Ola via Facebook I received a generic copy and pasted reply which only proceeded to patronise me by telling me that I was charged a higher rate because at the time I booked my trip it was busy, and all of this fare information was provided to me when booking the trip ... This information is only visible by clicking the minuscule ‘i’ on the fare total screen for more information, rather than being presented on the summary screen prior to requesting the Ola as you would expect. Ola knowingly hides this information so as to elicit additional funds from unsuspecting riders. This is dishonest and deceitful conduct. If the total fare is going to be increased due to surge pricing then Ola has the responsibility to clearly indicate this on the fare estimate screen at the point of booking the trip. It is not the user’s responsibility to navigate several layers deep to find that their fare may possibly increase.I strongly recommend you never use Ola, and instead try Uber, Didi or any of the other many competitors.

Headings: As a relatively long time user of Uber
Content: As a relatively long time user of Uber, I was pleased when I was heard about Ola a rival company. Uber is so handy, safe and easy to use it's only due to this that I kind of put up with the fact that they clearly aren't a super nice bunch of people. One of the main issues I have with Uber is their fare multipliers. I have gotten to the point when I find alternative ways to travel when I am told I will have to pay a higher fee due to the service being busy, seemingly as a kind of punishment as is dealt out to commuters in the Uk by train companies for going to work at the time they are told. The Uber driver that recommended Ola to me said I would get a £10 voucher for using it for the first time so I downloaded the app and gave it a go (i'm in Bristol, Uk). On the apps first use, I stood there for a while waiting for it to find me a driver and after about 2-3 mins it hadn't so I gave up and booted the Uber app. After I got home, I got a call from an unknown number which turned out to be the Ola driver that had obviously come to pick me up despite me cancelling the ride (this was after about half an hour), closing the app and then going in an Uber. He was not very pleasant on the phone and I eventually had to hang up. I looked for a customer service number for the Uk and there isn't one. Not one. There are two India based customer service numbers but not one for the Uk. I wasn't going to phone India at my cost to complain about the abuse.I've used Ola a couple of times since then and the fares are always about 10-15% more expensive than Uber and the app is poor to say the least so I decided to go back to Uber. Last night I went to Uber and they had a 1.2x multiplier on (overcharging because they can) so I went back to Ola. I booked a taxi which the app told the driver to go to the adjacent road despite making it very clear that it knew where I actually was standing (there is no pick up point editing like on the much better Uber app). I was taken just over a mile and a half, a journey that usually costs me £6-6.50 on a normal Uber day and this morning I got a receipt for £9.49 (!!!!). I had to email Ola (as they don't like talking to people from the Uk evidently) and to be fair, I got a callback from them within a couple of hours. The Indian guy listened as I asked why the price was so high and he explained that there was a 1.33x multiplier on. In the Uber app, this is made very clear (as are other details that are much harder to read on the Ola app for me) but I didn't notice it on the Ola app. Maybe this was my fault but I am relatively astute so I think it's more a case of their app being noticeably inferior to the competition. The Indian man quoted everything in dollars and cents and I had to repeatedly explain to him that the Uk doesn't use Dollars and cents. He constantly mispronounced my name and claimed he was in the Uk after finally admitting he was from an Indian call centre (it's not good to lie). He offered me £5 as an apology which I refused and then upped it to £10 which I also refused. I told him that I thought Ola was the poor cousin to Uber, the app is crap, the customer service is rubbish and the fares are more expensive than Uber. Anyone wanting to jump ship to Ola would be advised not to bother unless you like poor quality and prefer to pay more for it.

Headings: An absolute nightmare
Content: An absolute nightmare, perhaps that’s why impossible to actually contact them to make a complaint. Tried twice today to book a ride, both times failed. First time after 15 minutes of trying no car available. Second trip in the pouring rain the address entered was not where car was coming for pick up & it was impossible to change location or contact driver, charged for a ride I didn’t even get!

Headings: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER
Content: I want to share my todays WORST experience with OLA.I booked an auto and to at least 20 Kms from my destination.I added OLA money and after the driver ended the ride i came to know that ola money is not added and he asked me to pay cash.The atm was 2 kms away and i was getting late,i said him multiple times but he was stuck on the same thing.He gave me his paytm number but the limit was exceeded of his own paytm of accepting the money.Some how i managed to arrange cash and paid him.Now i am trying to book an auto or a cab but it's not allowing me to book as it says that i have not paid the previous amount.It shows "Payment Pending",i will have to pay then only i can book the other rides.Means it just "Wow" ,i paid cash,i had ola money,i tried paytm,nothing works out but still it says me pending payment,what an excellent service is provided after charging such huge amt of money.Paying is not an issue but no comfortability is surely an issue.The another thing i have noticed is that the auto drivers will never accept ola money,over the phone they say they need cash or else we can cancel the ride.Now we have to go according to the ola people and they will not go according to us.Another thing is one of the auto driver ended the ride before my destination as i asked him to wait for a minute as i had some work.he ended the ride half way and all my ola money was deducted.I would never recommend OLA rides to anyone,also as it is it's not allowing me to book a ride because of pending payment even after paying the money is cash. And then they want good rating.Keep your services up and then ask for rating.WORST EXPERIENCE EVER.

Headings: $153 for a cab fare that I never took
Content: Still awaiting a reply from Ola. Got charged $153 for a fare that normally costs $40. The kicker was that I never even got in the cab. They took someone else instead. So not only had to walk several kms home and take a train but somehow ended up $153 in the red. When asked what happened they said the driver took someone else instead?? This is an ongoing joke between me and my girlfriend, however a big warning to people. Customer service is rubbish. I have been promised several times that a supervisor would call me but never did. Has been 3 months and I don't expect them to ever reply. I am finally going to Consumer Affairs in Australia. Yes this app is cheaper but sooner or later you'll get burnt like me.

Headings: My bank account hurts, RIP OFF AND EXCUSES - SH#T COMPANY
Content: caught an Ola cab that said it was going to cost me $13 for the fare total. I had a coupon to get 50% off so then the quote was down to       $6-7. now I know that isn't much for a cab, but this was for a Saturday night at midnight heading into town with uni students. I thought a great deal and ordered it. on Monday I saw that I had been charged $13 which was the original quote, but that was with the coupon applied. so I took it to them and said hey, I would like a refund for the difference you charged me as I was quoted this amount and then charged this. easy, right. no, it's only $6 but being the poor, stubborn uni student, I wasn't letting this slide. they replied with 2 different excuses, saying the first being that we took a deviated route, which was true but that wasn't our problem, that was the route the driver chose to get us there. and the second excuse was that they had a 1.5 peak fare pricing added, which was not disclosed when I ordered it, and then said they have transparent pricing. bullsh#t. that is not transparent pricing, that ripping off a poor uni students bank account. emails have been sent back and forward without getting anywhere. would NOT recommend this cab company unless you want to be ripped off and charged double you were quoted on. will not be ordering again.

After waiting for up to 5-6 minutes between messages on online chat from the so-called customer support agent (it was like Chinese water torture); she finally agreed to reimburse me ... $1. I kid you not!! Don't waste your time with these fly-by-night cowboys – stick with Uber instead.

As being a customer of ola I am following up with the mail nobody is responding but I am getting a regular reminder for the service payment which I have not used. Headings: Got an Ola was meant to be $40 and they…
Content: Got an Ola was meant to be $40 and they charged me $70 what a rip off! Will never use Ola again! Won’t recommend anyone to use Ola!!

Headings: It is horrible company
Content: It is horrible company. I would not recommend anyone to use this company. I booked a cab for my parents for around midnight. They were half way in the middle of nowhere and the driver asked to get down and book another cab as he was running out of fuel. I spoke to customer care rep and it seems like they are least bothered about customer safety and satisfaction. I am very disappointed with the experience and will never book a ride again in future, neither I would recommend any one to book.

Headings: First time ever i booked ola cab
Content: First time ever i booked ola cab, firstly system was showing driver is 5 mins away i was waiting on the road for 30 minutes and then system started showing me 15 mins. The worst part is driver was not even driving to my direction. No customer service, no body answering phone call. Worst service Ola in NZ.

Headings: Drivers constantly cancel and refuse…
Content: Drivers constantly cancel and refuse duty with no consequences from the app or company. No support line for customers when things go wrong.

Headings: I was charged the cancellation fee…
Content: I was charged the cancellation fee several times which was cancelled by the driver. Called to the customer care attended by Mr.Pasheer, he was helpless saying that he couldn't track the history, there is no solution, he asked me to pay and use it again which  I was supposed not to pay. He didn't bother to loose a customer. Such a pathetic customer care Ola

Headings: Hire proffessional drivers.
Content: Hire proffessional drivers.. Last day I had an emergency and booked a ola cab. The cab driver called me that he would be at my pick up point in 5 minutes and asked where was the drop and somewhere I figured that he wouldn't turn up. He was at my location. When I went towards the cab, he moved to the other side of the road and moved the cab away from my location. I called him he answered my call and wouldn't speak at all. He played around me for about 7 minutes to show that I was not boarding the cab or to delay so that would be my mistake. I cancelled the cab giving the reason as he refuses to pick me up. 2nd driver when called him spoke to me so rudely that I was traveling for free. He says " he would take 10 minutes to come if interested wait or else cancel the cab". But in the map it was showing that he was a minute away and when asked him he says "Didn't I tell that you should wait".Your support sucks. So safely your company plays around. You don't even have a valid support number either on your website or the ola app. I hope your company should be shut down shortly looking at the reviews and ratings.Here is the driver's details where you wouldn't even care but do see it - silver Indica, vehicle#: KA05AE 6475Driver's name: NandeeshDriver's contact: +919071888753

Headings: Dangerous incompetent driving
Content: The last time i caught an ola has scarred me and i will not use their service again. I doubt very much the driver had a licence,  his skills were so bad, I feared for my safety. No indicating,  last min changes of lanes, not checking if the lane was free before moving. Horrendous! Furthermore he was unable to follow navigation. My journey from pyrmont to hunters hill went via glebe rather than straight over Anzac bridge and we almost made it back onto Anzac bridge when he suddenly swerved to exit onto Anzac bridge rather than follow the nav to victoria road. I had to direct him numerous times on a simple journey even though he was following the nav.  I left a detailed 1 star review and ola never contacted me, they obviously don't care about their customers. Never again!!!

Headings: Ola services r becoming worse day by…
Content: Ola services r becoming worse day by day..drivers give excuses like it will take time to reach you or tyre is punctured etc. and ask to cancel..really disappointing

Headings: There is a reason this company has terrible rating OLA
Content: There is a reason this company has a terrible rating. Got charged over $90 for a ride i never took. It has taken them more than two weeks and so far have only been refunded $14.Then they sent me an email to say they had called my phone and because i didnt pick up they have closed my ticket. I have gone through all my phone logs and not a single call had been placed to me. Never use this service again.

Headings: Payment scam! - DOUBLE charge
Content: OLA charges you the quoted fee via ADYEN finance system then they charge you a final price when the trip is compete. So you’re charged twice until one of them disappears from your credit card. This takes up to 5 days. ** Here’s how it goes:When you books OLA, it gives you a quote which seems a lot cheaper than Uber. In the end, it’s nearly the same as Uber. You need to authorize the quote fee (payment) to proceed with the booking - there’s a disclaimer flashing when you ok on the quote and it disappears so quickly and you can’t even read properly. Once the trip is compete, it’s always a lot more expensive that the quoted fee. After the completion of the trip, I realized that I was charged twice - quote and final fee. Both says pending on my credit card. After 4-5 days, the quoted fee charge disappears and you’re only charged the final fee. So I gather that OLA is benefiting by holding my money for a few days. They’re doing this to all OLA riders which will become a very substantial lump sum. I’d call this scam.

CRN - 2711153150Cab was Bad Stinking, even after complaining the customer care they didnt resolve - Customer Care executive - Rishabh. Its really BAD. OLA cheating you with POOR quality of services by charging high prices with NO VALUE for money.

Headings: App crashed, charged cancellation fee
Content: App crashed & I could not track the booked car. Had to cancel and got charged $10 cancellation fee.

Headings: Service is not so good and should take…
Content: Service is not so good and should take more care about customers. I had a bad experience from a customer and gave a negative review on the app itself. They didn't even bother to call back and enquire.

Headings: Most of the times drivers cancel the…
Content: Most of the times drivers cancel the ride after making us wait for 15-20/min. Ola charges us the cancellation charges. This has become quite frequent. There is no customer service number to call. No action will be taken on erring drivers also.

Headings: Irresponsible driver n bull worthless OLA
Content: I booked a OLA today at wyndham vale Melbourne and there was a wait of 11 mins we waited fr that time the cab arrived at the pick up location i waived looking at the driver and asked him to come forward so that we can get in he came fwd and when my husband came ahead to board the cab he just went off n dint picked us ..this is such a shame and a disgust. Was the driver thinking that i am alone and when he saw my husband he ran away what intention was that i am scared of booking ola now third grade service cheap and povert drivers and above all they charged me $10 cancellation fee. Useless n shameless is the word fr the driver by name Mohit Vig car no 996 white i45. So much time was wasted i wish his license gets canx fr such rubbish behavior

Headings: Do not use!!
Content: I ordered a Ola cab. The driver couldn't find me. Abused me on the phone. Had to use Uber. Got charged by ola. Sent multiple feedback to support team no response and no refund. What a joke. I have cancelled the app. Will never use again. Stay awsy

Headings: Cab Driver Misbehaved.
Content: I booked a cab for pickup of a guest who were arriving at the International Airport. I forwarded the necessary contact details to both the driver and my guests. The driver was bashfully impolite. He refused to coordinate his location with that of my guests by choosing to stand his ground whilst my guests took one whole hour to trace him. He was deliberately inconsiderate and unhelpful. He refused to place the luggage bags on the carrier of the car for my aged guests when the boot would not take the load of everything they were carrying AFTER the insolent behaviour he showcased earlier and this was at 1am at night when usually a traveller is drained and tired from their days engagement. I strongly dissuade all to use OLA

Headings: Im an ola driver but wont be much…
Content: Im an ola driver but wont be much longer. Things were going fine i was enjoying the low commision rates and the flexibility of getting paid daily. Then last night a rider made a mess in my vechicle - she vomited everywhere. The app is completely useless there was no way i could select 'rider made a mess in my vechicle' because there were only a few options to choose from. Eventually i had to write a 'ticket.'The first time i wrote it, i sent it and shortly afterward it just simply dissapeared. So i wrote a second ticket and they havent bothered to reply to that, either. That was a few days ago. All the while my car stinking out and i cant accept rides.

Headings: They charge me $15 without ride driver…
Content: They charge me $15 without ride driver is too far away i cancel the ride . They charge me 15$.

Headings: Faulty app
Content: Faulty app. Can't add payment method and support is unhelpful.

Headings: If I could give a zero I would
Content: If I could give a zero, I would. The driving experiences were good, but I can tell you that the payment is not. We used a promo code for a free ride in July ‘18. In Dec ‘18, I receive an email for that ride saying I have not paid for it, and that our attached bank card would be transacted the funds. I honestly wrote it off to be a scam email, as I had settled the account (also, I had used the free ride). Within the week, I am receiving debt collection emails for not only my account, but for a second account, which is not my account, but for the same amount of money owed on my account. The debt collection agency won’t wipe it, and I’m not dealing with a clunky system of emailing, instead of being able to ring someone and sort this out straight away. I’m not happy, as this affects my credit rating. Poor form Ola. I don’t care if it is rectified; I shouldn’t have to deal with this mess in the first place. Never in my life have I had a debt collector after me, and have a pristine credit rating. Now it is taking too long to deal with this rubbish.

Headings: OLA RIDES ARE NOT SAFE ENOUGH
Content: YES, THIS IS ABSOLUTELY TRUE.. OLA rides are not safe enough now, Specially for Ladies.Today, I had booked an OLA Cab for my wife from Sector 78, Noida to New Delhi Railway Station, Paharganj. Their were 4 incident happened very badly and details are given below.1)   Driver was driving so fast and was just about to hit another car on Dadri road. 2)   Driver stopped a cab after just 5mins. driving without permission/intimation for pee on the road, usually they have enough time before starting their journey for all of these and the waiting charges applied to the passenger.3)   He didn't pay the MCD toll tax from Noida to Delhi and ran the car, where as OLA charged us Rs. 100/- usually.4)   Now this is really not acceptable, Driver had dropped the passenger at the Ajmeri Gate without information, when the booking was done for Paharganj. And Ajmeri gate station was too far from where he dropped. Because of his stupidity, Passenger had missed her train. And When passenger asked him to drop Paharganj side, he denied and said their is a traffic jam that side and he totally ignored the passenger's need.Driver Details:D. name : Irfan HaiderD. Mobile No. 7533935653Cab no. DL ** ** 6955One more thing, OLA has also charge for AC in winter season where their driver are not using AC in winter. Instead, they open car window to get all pollution in the cab and doesn't care about passenger. When Passenger try to say switch on the AC on normal temperature, they say, it's already winter and no need of AC.Me, my colleagues, family and friends are are not going to use OLA services from now onwards. Are you?

Headings: Charged for driver's wrong route!
Content: I booked a ride and the estimated fare was about 4$ thanks to a 50% discount. It was a 5min drive from where I was. The driver took an incorrect route and the ride lasted for 13min instead of 5. The driver charged me for his mistake and my fare was doubled. My bank account was charged twice! This is outrageous! On top of that, he made miss my train while the purpose of taking a cab was being able to catch it on time! Do not ride with Ola cabs! I was duped and there even isn't any proper contact number in Australia to have customer support!

Headings: S*i*
Content: I wouldn’t even rate Ola one star. I tried to use the app and wasn’t able to book a cab as It wouldn’t accept my card details.

Headings: Don't even want to give this 1 star...-1 star from me
Content: Don't even want to give this 1 star but i have too.Disgusting service, My first ride and firstly taxi driving got a bit funny as he picked up wrong place.I had £10 off first ride on a journey i had paid £15 earlier today with the 3s.My fair was nearly £28 so still paid Nearly £18 with £10 off.The driver said the link road would be fastest and cheapest but clearly wasn't.I will be going through my bank to get money back out of principle.Lastly i have delete this conning app and will stick to all the 3s or 5s in future.This same message will be going all over my social media apps.Disgusting app and service.My taxi journey was from Cardiff city centre to Ely. Paid less on New Years Eve with Capitol lol.

Headings: New Year’s Eve on the Gold Coast and…
Content: New Year’s Eve on the Gold Coast and couldn’t get a ride at 130am. Deleted app got an Uber

Headings: Never again
Content: Please avoid using this company. We have had horrendous experiences using this app. Both times the driver has accepted our trips and was still underway their current route taking more than 30 minutes to pick us up. We also had so much difficulty signing up to the app as their is an error with the card. We will will stick with Uber.

Headings: Rating will be "0"
Content: 1. Pricing is too high.2. Drivers are not proper. Before starting a ride, driver will ask whether it is OLA money, cash or postpaid. If we say OLA Money, then some will cancel the trips and others will take a longer route. They do not listen to the customers. If the distance is too far, they will cancel the trip again. 3. My issue is still not resolved. I ended up paying 700 rupees extra for a trip of 25 kms. Ofcourse, you guys trust your drivers more than the customers. Driver took cash of 450 rupees and at the same time ola money was deducted and 450 rupees was charged to my postpaid account. During this trip driver was waiting down to change my trip location and he did not move an inch until I changed the location. Is this the safety you're providing to female travelers? Moreover, he was saying madam I will get extra amount, so that I do not have to go for another trip kindly change the location to my home. 4. Drivers teach us the routing to our homes also. They will not go in the route which the customers want and they will stop the cab in between at 10.30 PM. Do they have sense? I am not going to use OLA services anymore. Too many worst experiences with this service provider. I have raised many of these issues several times, but nothing has been done from your end. The customer executives will say you will get a call back today and that today will never come. For a trip of 600 I ended up paying 1200 which is the worst. Trust your drivers. Uber is much better in pricing. Coupons provided cannot be applied. Worst drivers and worst services.

Headings: As a driver....
Content: As a driver. I have only used ola a few times. The app is terrible. It makes it hard and stressful to find customers, it is so bad its embarrasing!Uber app works really well.

Headings: App said 2 minutes and 20 minutes later car heading wrong way
Content: Booked an Ola when the app said a car was 2 minutes away.  After booking it said 4 minutes but 10 minutes later the car had not moved (driver having lunch maybe?).  Rang driver to ask him what the problem was.  He said traffic (rubbish).  After another 8 minutes the car headed off in wrong direction.  So 20 minutes after booking, the car was going the wrong way.  I cancelled, furious because was now late for appointment and booked Uber.  RUBBISH SERVICE!

Headings: Honestly don’t waste your time!
Content: Honestly don’t waste your time!, I booked a Ola this evening after shopping as I had loads of bags on me, I pin pointed my location, in the car park, as I was waiting for the taxi to arrive I noticed it had stopped on a road on the opposite side of the car park, so I got all my bags and walked to the other side, I got to the car and asked if it was for me which he replied yes it’s for (and answered my full name) and when I got in the taxi I then glt told he had cancelled because he couldn’t see me, baring in mind I was where I was supposed to be!, anyway he cancelled it started looking for another ride for me, another one was on its way, when he turnt up I asked if my discount had came over to this booking as I booked the other one with it and he said he doesn’t know I would have to ring up ola, so I asked for a contact number which he told me I could find on the app, I spent around 3-4 minutes looking for a contact number for them on the app and on google however could not find one! I have looked up and noticed we are going to the completely wrong way than where I booked, I asked him what he was doing and where was he going and he told me that it had been booked for somewhere different (when it was not) he told me I had to change the drop off point which I told him I did not know how to do as I haven’t used them for long, he then cancelled my booking and told me to look for a new one, when I did this it was double the price as before which I then asked if he had a contact number with his boss or with someone I could speak to so I could explain what had happened to see if they was able to transfer the discount over or something, then he turnt round to me and told me to ‘get the f*** out his car’ ‘he was the driver so he could tell me what I can and can’t do’ and shouting abuse at me, I am an 18 year old girl and of course a grown man shouting abuse at you is going to make you upset, which is what happened to me, he left me on the side of a road, somewhere I had no idea where I was, my phone was about to die, and I had loads of shopping with me, luckily I was able to use a women’s phone to phone my partner and he was able to order me a taxi from the petrol station down the road!, anyway when I finally got home I sent a email to Ola regarding what had happened, I then got a phone call to be told the have no records of the first booking baring in my he said my full name so how would he of had those details otherwise??, absolutely horrible service!!, would not recommend! Go steady everyone.

Headings: Cheap but most annoying app
Content: Cheaper than competitors. But the booking process drives me up the wall with the frequent cancellations. Don’t bother referring friends. Referred 3 friends so far, but because the rides keep getting cancelled by the driver/app, the referral code becomes invalid for that user when they have to book another cab.

Headings: Woeful app and service
Content: Woeful app and service. Don’t waste your time. The driver will cancel and not turn up

Headings: wonderful customer service
Content: I am writing down this to give a feedback of my experience with ola cabs at the airport in Mumbai.Must say ola has got up as a brand very well. and the staff at the airport were very friendly in helpful to me . I was at the t2 termial at approx 20:30hrs getting a cab at that point had become a big task for me. i was upset as my ride got cancelled i was yelling at the tall built guy at the parking wasim khan but must say high tolerence power helpful, quick with a solution to the problem. I personally waana apologise for my behaviour at the parking to him, but he didnt utter a word back, and was very helpful. must say good customer service .

Headings: What a waste of time.
Content: What a waste of time. Useless. Driver 5 min away and heading towards me, 5 min later and he is now 10min away any heading in the ipposite direction. Ola, you can f#*k off.

Headings: Scamming drivers
Content: 3 times I have tried my luck with ola after people suggested it to me. Tonight for the THIRD time I have booked, it says driver on the way and then 5 seconds later: thank you for your trip, you've been charged, please rate your driver!  I assume there is some way drivers can say they've picked up without doing so and collecting the fare anyway. Absolute scam.

Headings: Opened App last night to try to book an…
Content: Opened App last night to try to book an OLA. App wouldn't allow me to book. Got home after catching a taxi and OLA had charged me $10. Not happy!!!

Headings: Awful do not book
Content: Awful do not book, booked then car cancelled lost all money left on account waste of money. Then account wouldn’t left me protest. Awful company will be contact consumer affairs. Save your money and book a taxi

Headings: Filthy cars with cigarettes ashes all…
Content: Filthy cars with cigarettes ashes all over and the driver is on the phone all along. I have recorded the voice and have the pics of the car. When I reached out to ola they don't want to refund. No apology

Headings: Never again - Back to Uber
Content: So ... decided to give Ola a try last night for the first time to see how it compared to UberCreated an account and got send a code which should have given me 50% of my ride.Entered the code… but the system only gave me 25% off.Came to work this morning, and I’ve got an e-mail which at the top, clearly specifies that there should be 50% off… But that a 25AUS coupon has been applied and the discount that I received was clearly only 25%So, in an attempt to give them the opportunity to rectify the mistake, I shot an e-mail off to the support team with the e-mail detailing this.… The response…“I've received the discount I was due to receive.”

Headings: AVOID ALL COSTS
Content: This is a substandard technology platform with very poor customer service. At first I was keen to support Ola due to their driver payments- however after a good experience I discovered their technology allowed drivers to accept rides- only to never move on the APP map or turn up. By the time you realise the APP doesn't work you get stung $10. This occurred on several occasions so I decided to delete the APP....and then only end up getting chased by their debt recovery agency for a $10 cancellation fee- absolutely extortion. Take you business elsewhere!

Headings: I've only had BAD experiences with Ola…
Content: I've only had BAD experiences with Ola and will be returning to uber. Neither mine nor my friends coupons were applied and none of us recieved refunds for these. The coupons also have a very short expiry. I sent screenshots, explained my situation and was not provided a resolution. I've had a drama with uber but they were very helpful and happy to provide a refund for their mistake.I have also had a driver once accept a ride which said he was 11 minutes away after 7 minutes the car hadn't  moved position, I thought my screen was playing up. I called the driver and he asked where I was going and If I still wanted him to come, sounding like he'd hope I'd cancel. He then took another 5 minutes to leave the same spot on the map, making me wait about 25 mins for my ride.

Headings: DO NOT USE OLA! DO NOT USE OLA! DO NOT USE OLA!
Content: If i could rate Ola Cabs a ZERO, then I would.The driver (name is Mohammed) I had was at first very friendly, he let me listen to my own music and have a little sing a long in the car. I was with a family member and we were returning from the city after a night out back to the suburbs, so we were a little tipsy as we had had a few drinks. The trip was anywhere from 45-50 minutes, so the driver was chatty and friendly - no issue with him at all. However, the situation changed as we turned into my street. As I left the vehicle, I realized that I had left the iPhone adapter in the AUX cord, so i turned about around i retrieved my item. As i bent over to get my item back, the driver felt the need to squeeze my left breast. I obviously screamed and shouted at him and asked him if he thought this was ok. He then took off and sped around the corner.Not only is this unacceptable... it is sexual misconduct/assault. I did not ask him to touch me or give him any reason too. As the Ola was booked under my  family members account, we made a complaint the next day via the app, however that was maybe 3 weeks ago now and we STILL haven't heard anything back. I will NEVER use Ola again. I have told all of my friends who have now deleted Ola from their phones. Ola is a disgrace of a company and cannot believe they employ drivers like him. Do Ola even complete background/police checks before hiring these people.

Headings: Not trustworthy
Content: Tried Ola for the first time yesterday. I booked a ride to take my elderly Mum home from an event in the city. The driver took an innordinately long you’re to her house ( told get the machine made him do it) and then  Ola had the nerve to charge me extra for “journey time” , which I can only assume means a journey time beyond that forecast . There were also lots of other little charges including “tax” which in WA is GST and should by law be quoted in the price.

Headings: Worst service ever
Content: Worst service ever. I was sick and in pain when I needed a ride to home. They charged me for the ride I never got. The app says I have been picked up and dropped off. They don’t have customer service available as well. Tired reporting it but it says due to technical error the report can not be submitted please call. When tired to call it’s shows 15 digit number. Please save yourself from hassle of using this garbage.

Headings: What’s wrong with this company?
Content: I was in a hurry to go to airport. I booked Ola and the app says that the driver is only 5 minutes away. I waited for more than 20 minutes while checking the app and the app tells me that the driver is going to an opposite direction and he’s 30 minutes away from me. I called the driver 3 times but he didn’t answer my calls neither he cancel my ride. Last I can’t wait any longer so I book another ride from another app. But I still so disappointed because when I cancel the ride because I can’t wait any longer it says that I have to pay for the cancellation fees. I don’t wanna waste my money for a bad service like this. Totally dissapointed!!! The driver never came and neither he answer to my calls!!! yet I have to pay for the cancellation fees sooooooo dissapointed. I think this is like a scam for me. I have all the screenshots via the app when the driver going to a completely differrent direction and the record that I called him but he didn’t answer.

Headings: Worst  Company I have ever had the dis…
Content: Worst  Company I have ever had the dis pleasure of dealing with.There app had me being picked up at the wrong address, then I watch it on screen and it says I have been picked up, then priceeded to charge me.Absolute Joke of a company and will not respond to any communication. Give this joke of a company a big miss and stay with Uber !

Headings: This company is an absolute joke
Content: This company is an absolute joke. I have tried to book rides on two occasions and have had a total of $150 or more taken from my account in preauthorised transactions (which is gone for several days before being returned due to bank policies) for a total of 1 ride worth just over $20 being actually received. All of these charges are due to Ola cabs unreliable drivers continuously cancelling after accepting jobs to take jobs worth more money. This is completely unacceptable behaviour when payments are preauthorised upon accepting a ride. I will never be using this garbage app again. And guess what you can’t even contact them by phone to lodge a complaint, they are only reachable by email. Probably because they know that they would receive constant angry calls from customers. In the several years i have used Uber i have never had a single experience like this.

Headings: Terrible experience OLA Perth
Content: Terrible experience with unexplained charges on my card, lost drivers and unavailable service.

Headings: I was charged for a ride that never…
Content: I was charged for a ride that never eventuates. I called the driver to see how far away he was and he said he didn’t have me down as requesting a cab. That was a complete lie. I have deleted the app.

Headings: Driver called to say cant find my…
Content: Driver called to say cant find my address...but in an instance...i saw him arriving but sped off soon after. Called him but not picking up call. Crap Ola..make you pay for cancellation fees...

Headings: Just watched 2 of my friends get…
Content: Just watched 2 of my friends get charged for a ride that they didn't get - the driver accepted the ride, and then started to drive away from pickup point and toward the destination. The app reflected that they had been picked up but this was not the case. They then tried to call the driver numerous times but he would not answer the calls. There was absolutely no help in the support section, or any Australian number to call customer support. I have not used Ola myself and will definitely not be trying it after witnessing this experience. If I could give a 0 star rating, I would.

Headings: Ola Brisbane - awful service
Content: Ola Brisbane : random extra charges which differs highly from the approx cost shown in App, some drivers drive the car either with an attitude of giving free service or like taking passenger on a joyride ( driving with hands off the steering), extremely casual attire which makes the passenger feel uncomfortable, changes route for no reason just to increase the bill. Beware of fake charge shown in the app, as it has nothing to do with the original bill.

Headings: OLA INDIA
Content: This is regarding the drivers that ola has hired and the service that ola is providing here in INDIA. First of all i would start with the riders ola has hired: Most of them are unprofessional. Does not even know the basic driving rules. Reckless driving and there unprofessional behavior is a pain.No safety gears have been provided particularly in the case of bike rides.In case of any accident or damage to you and your belongings, here is a good news you call support and ask for any compensation the just pass calls from one person to another and then at the end Ola executives starts to dictate there term and conditions. As per my today's experience, I booked a bike ride in Noida. Bike rider did not had any extra helmet or any safety gears. Drove me to my place and in between bumped into a care due to carelessness of both parties.My hand was wounded phone was broken, Biker got up and started to ride. He was concerned about completing the ride. The Car driver ran away. When i talked to OLA customer care about this and asked about any insurance or coverage for the accident, The answer i received is embarrassing, " Sir we are sorry as we are unable to help you as per our policies. We do not have any Insurance for the customer. We will take action toward the rider and you may go, launch an FIR and we will provide support if required."This is how these Companies making money. They are not concerned about there customers. I am very furious and angry on the Indian government as how they issue licence to these companies. No insurance, What the hell wrong with the policy makers and the one who review and approve such things.The condition of the vehicle, skill set of the driver, Safety of the customer, Fares all compromised.Fares goes up and down as per there convenience  and you can never be sure about the consistency in there ride fairs.To the people who drive on road, Kindly look toward the person got injured by you or any on else. It may be your mistake or may be any one else committed the accident. Just do not run away. Talking can solve many problems and do not think that running away will solve your problem. Just help the person got injured. Extend a kind gesture and half the problem will be solved.Its my request to Indian Government to consider my request and check for the loop holes in the policies of these companies.For the reference to OLA : CRN 2438336349.

Headings: The most useless way to get home
Content: The most useless way to get homeThis email I sent them explains my story4 friends and I went to a concert in a less than desirable suburb, all of us too young to drive and the public transport in the area not coming for another hour and a half. We planned to walk to a location and order an Ola to the train station and then get the train home. We signed up for the app and as there were five of us we tried to order a large Ola. We had two people on separate devices looking to order and after about 15 minutes the app told us that there aren’t any 6 seaters available. That was ok, so we decided to order two small cars and go in two groups. The first person ordered and came. The map on the app was completely wrong saying their driver was in a completely different location, and when the driver arrived they stopped in the middle of a main road and got my friends to get in there, even though there was a carpark right next to us which we asked him to pull in to. After that the three of us tried to order another one. We were connected to our first driver who was 11 minutes away to begin with. He called me to confirm my location? Even though I had already placed It in the app, and then as soon as we got off the phone he drove the opposite way to us and after 5 minutes of watching the driver go the complete wrong way he cancelled and we had to wait 10 minutes for the app to find us a new car. The next car again was 9 minutes away and driving the completely wrong way down the main road we were on. I called this driver to ask why he was going the wrong way and he told me to just wait a few minutes. He then turned around and appeared to be going the right way which I was relived about because at this time we had already been sitting on the side of a road for 40 minutes. This is 3 girls at the age of 16 who have relied on YOUR service to get home safely. The car is then driving back up the road towards us, and when it gets back to being 9 minutes away it turns onto a street again, going to completely wrong way. I call the driver again and he declines my call. The app then says that we have been picked up, which we had NOT. The ride then says it’s over, but we were still sitting on the side of the road! We then tried ONE more time, by this point we had been there for about an hour, and after 10 minutes of the app trying to find us a car we gave up. We then ordered an uber, it came in three minutes and pulled over safely onto a side street and got us to exactly where we wanted to go quickly, comfortable and safely.

Headings: Terrible experience
Content: Terrible experience. Cabbie was fine but technology and customer support has been a total failure. My card was charged twice for the same ride, this was over 2 weeks ago and despite repeated attempts at contacting OLA through the app function and email, sending screenshots of my banking to prove this unauthorised charge, they still haven’t gotten back to me, much less reversed the charge. Yes Uber is a bit more expensive but at least if they accidentally double charge me they would refund the money instantly.

Headings: Ola service might slightly cheap…
Content: Ola service might slightly cheap compare to uber but horrible service. Their map always give wrong location.  It often happens with me I am waiting in a location and driver waiting in different location. It means extra charge from me . Unhappy customer and driver.  The app shows shorter waiting time and when you request the ride the waiting period increase.  Also when you waiting for the ride all a sudden your waiting period increase results in all sort of inconveniences if you running late. Really bad experience overall.  I rather pay extra and use other services than ola.

Headings: Disappointed
Content: Ola sucks at the moment with the fact that when you request a ride, drivers are around 10 minutes away. And sometimes once your ride gets accepted, your driver then decides to cancel on you which is pretty frustrating. With Uber requesting a ride usually brings in a driver that is just a few minutes away.

Headings: It's the worst cab service you can ever…
Content: It's the worst cab service you can ever experience. OLA mobile app itself has lots of bugs (trust me very serious bugs!)We did a booking last week from the sydney airport pickup location. App showed ETA as 3 mins. Within the next minute driver called and said it will take 10 mins for him to arrive (but the app still shows 3 mins). Then less than a minute time got an alert saying driver cancelled the trip. Same time there was a deduction from my bank card to the full estimated fare of AUD 35. Ola app deducted money from my card for a never showed up taxi for the full estimated fare!I tried searching for a OLA support contact number and there's no number as such listed on their web site. There's a support email ID which they only replied to me once saying there was a OLA system technical issue but never got back to me after that. I'm asking an update daily basis (I want my money back!) but no update as yet.Please don't don't use OLA app giving your credit card details.They have a coupon system which is also buggy which you will end up paying more.

Headings: Unprofessional service
Content: I usually do not write bad reviews since I think businesses sometimes cannot fulfil customer expectations and thats ok. But I have to make a complaint about Olacab service since they dont have a  complaint facility in their support section.The worst cab service I have ever encountered.No accountability from drivers at all. They cancel the ride after accepting it since they know we cannot give feedback.It is frustrating and unprofessional behaviour.Other services like Uber are little more expensive but I never had such a bad experience with them.

Headings: They advertised a deal but over charged…
Content: They advertised a deal but over charged me (by a lot). When I contacted them about my stolen money, they told me it was too late (you apparently only get 3 days to report any money stolen by these thieves) and that they werent going to give my stolen money back.Dirty money grabbing thieves.

Headings: The driver
Content: The driver , Arun kumar, actually drove over my foot,  when the door was open and I was standing next to it. He didn't even care to see if the customer was in the car or out.Customer service was horrible. They didn't seem to care about it. All they asked was if the driver has been paid.They are a bunch of arrogant and completely careless people.Use uber instead.

Content: Just saw a lady verbally assaulted by extremely aggressive driver. Have reported him to the Police. There is no way he should be on the road. Very disturbing.

Headings: Absolutely terrible customer service
Content: Absolutely terrible customer service. I have had a number of issues and each time I contact support, they mark it as resolved, without actually resolving anything. Also be aware the referral bonus they offer you expires within a week and they do not even warn you about this. Other problems experience include driver getting lost and charging extra and on a seperate occasion the driver stopping suddenly/taking off quickly. Only good thing is it is cheaper than Uber.

Headings: I have had a terrible first experience…
Content: I have had a terrible first experience with OLA. Yet I am giving a 3 star review in acknowledgement of their efforts.Like few others in the reviews. I booked an OLA for the first time only to be cancelled by the driver. Funnily, instead of just being cancelled by the driver, the driver called me and asked me to cancel. When I tried to talk with him as to why, he simply mocked me and hung up the phone saying that i would be charged a fee if i don't cancel soon and he would be getting free money.The silver lining came from when I sent OLA cabs an email detailing this story to inform them of this driver's conduct. OLA called me almost instantly to talk with me on what happened and to assure me that this wasn't what the company represented nor would they let this slide.the experience overall was worth less than a star from the driver but the company showed genuine concern when they called me almost instantly in response to my email. This is why I may consider giving OLA another go and the reason for me leaving a neutral rating and not a negative one.The driver may have been offensive but it is not the company's fault and shouldn't reflect badly on them after they show such commitment to their users.

Headings: Deleting app & will never use again
Content: Deleting app & will never use again. 1st driver cancelled for no reason & there were no other drivers available. App not user friendly.

Headings: Very poor experience with Ola
Content: Very poor experience with Ola.  Downloaded the app. Took me 20 minutes and 5 attempts to register payment card details.  Eventually done - tried to book my first cab from Newport to Cwmbran.  Driver accepted the booking - started to go the opposite direction. Didn't take my call when I tried to find out what was happening. Driver cancelled the booking.  App now deleted and sticking to taxis. Sent this to their 24/7 customer support - still no response.  DO NOT TRUST THIS COMPANY.

Headings: Scam Artists
Content: I’ve been a regular ride share user for the last 5 years and would generally take an Uber around 4-5 times a week.  In the last few months I switched over to Ola thinking I could save some $$$  Worse decision ever!!  I did not proceed with a ride one night as phone ran out of battery and couldn’t locate driver.  When got home later that night saw I had been deducted over $120 in fare.  When opened the map the ola driver had kept app on for over two hours and drove all around Melbourne making about 10 different stops.  It seems obvious that he had not canceled my booking but instead kept it open while he used another ride share app to pick up and drop off passengers to double up in fees.   I complained to ola and after three weeks got a response back saying the driver said i had  taken the booked ride and they wouldnt refund the fees.   I have proof I was not in the car at that time including receipt I was at ATM on opposite side of town from where car was.  Anyone would see if looked at map that no one would take a ride in that way.    Uber would have resolved this immediately. Now what ever saving I thought I was making with Ola is non-existent.  Definitely won’t make same mistake again!!
